speaker: Doctor
text: So, you've been experiencing a pruritic rash on your trunk and extremities. Can you tell me when exactly did this rash start and how long you've been experiencing symptoms like low-grade fever, rhinorrhea, and headache?

speaker: Patient
text: "It started about two days ago, and then I had a fever, a runny nose, and a headache a week ago. The fever was really mild, but my nose was super runny, and my head felt a bit sore."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the rash itself - is it itchy constantly, or does it come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's mildly itchy, but it's not constant. Sometimes it feels a bit scratchy, and other times it just feels like a weird tingle. It's not super uncomfortable, but it's definitely noticeable."

speaker: Doctor
text: "When did you first notice the rash was itchy, and have you experienced any triggers that make the itching worse or better?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Honestly, doc, I'm not really sure when the itching started, but I think it was after the fever went away. And as for triggers, my mom says I get a bit itchier when I scratch my skin a lot, but she also says I have an allergy to something at school, so maybe that's related?"

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to take a closer look at the rash. Can you please lift your arm for me to examine the affected area?

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, doc, I'll lift my arm for you. Oh, and do you need to look at my other arm too? The rash is on both my arms and it's kind of spreading."

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you please lift the other arm so I can examine it as well? 

And, I'd like to take a look at your hands and feet to see if there's any involvement there, too.

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, doc, I'll lift my other arm now. And yeah, my hands and feet are a bit itchy too, but they're not as bad as my arms and legs. My mom says it's possible that it's spreading because I've been scratching a lot."

speaker: Doctor
text:
I'm going to take a look at your hands and feet now. Can you please show me any areas that might be involved on your hands and feet, and are there any other symptoms such as swelling or redness in these areas?



Also, can you tell me about your recent activities, have you traveled anywhere recently, or been around anyone who's been sick recently?



Also, I'd like to request a test: REQUEST TEST: Complete_Blood_Count

speaker: Measurement
text:

Additional Findings: Rash also present on hands and feet, with involvement of palms and soles.

speaker: Doctor
text:

Can you tell me about any activities you've done recently that might have exposed you to something new, like a bug bite or a new environment?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've been going to school and playing with my friends a lot, and we've been playing outside a lot too. I don't think I've been bitten by any bugs, but I did have a friend who got a really bad bug bite a few days ago. We were playing tag in the playground, and I'm pretty sure I was the one who got bitten."

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about the activities you've done recently that might have exposed you to something new? 

Have you been around any plants, like poison ivy or oak, that could cause an allergic reaction? 

Also, have you been taking any new medications or supplements recently that could be causing an allergic reaction or an immune response?

speaker: Patient
text:
"Oh, I don't think I've been around any plants like that, doc. We play tag on the playground, but I don't think any of the plants there are like that. And, I don't think I've taken any new meds or supplements, but I did get a new backpack at school that I'm still breaking in."

"Actually, my mom says I was playing with some new friends during recess, and we were all sharing our lunches, so maybe that could be something?"

speaker: Doctor
text:

Also, have you noticed any patterns to the rash, like is it more severe at night or in certain weather conditions?



Can you please describe the rash's appearance, is it red, scaly, or blistering?



Can you tell me more about your recent activities, have you been swimming or been in contact with any animals recently?



Can you also tell me about your allergies, do you have any known allergies to plants, dust, or other substances that could be contributing to this rash?
